summary:
IT & Media educated engineer with a passion for new technologies. Always on the look-out to further automate and improve Software Development workflows and pipelines.

Experience in:
• Software build- / deployment tools and pipelines (CI/CD)
• Docker and Kubernetes (K8s)
• Terraform
• Salt
• AWS
• Vulnerability scanning/hardening
• Virtualization technologies
• Linux system maintenance and monitoring
• Designing VOD / OTT / Post Production workflows and its technical processes
• Ruby and Shell scripting
• Technical on-boarding and consulting for large clients
• Video encoding technologies and methods (DVB, HEVC, HDR10, Dolby Vision)
• Video encoding systems (AWS Elemental, FFmpeg, Rhozet Carbon, SAM Alchemist)
• Agile / Scrum methodology using Atlassian stack
• AI services (specifically Speech-To-Text)

school.name: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)

company.name: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)

profile_positions.description:
As a DevOps Engineer it’s my responsibility to streamline the processes in which our in-house developed software is being built and rolled out. I work on our (container) infrastructure, continuous integration and continuous deployment scenarios. I am furthermore focused on removing barriers between our software development-, IT- and application support departments. This includes:

• Creating and maintaining automated build and deployment pipelines (CI/CD).
• Setting up test automation to ensure flawless deployment.
• Configuring and maintaining our Docker and Kubernetes platform.
• Managing our AWS cloud environment.
• Setting up monitoring to maintain high availability.
• Performing security hardening and software upgrades on our production services.
• Researching and deploying new technologies.
• Requesting on-premise IT resources (such as: VM’s, network infrastructure, Firewall rules and DNS entries) to host our applications.
• Performing root cause analysis during technical issues.
• Coaching other employees DevOps methodologies.

Tools and techniques used:
• Jenkins
• Terraform
• Docker
• Kubernetes (K8s)
• AWS (building VPCs, EC2s, ELBs)
• Linux, mostly CentOS
• Git
• Visual Studio Code
• IIS
profile_positions.title: Senior DevOps Engineer

profile_positions.title: DevOps Engineer

profile_positions.description:
As a Workflow Specialist I operated right in the middle between our software development department, our operations department and our clients. It was my job to advice clients and colleagues on Workflow automation and connect the necessary parts of most of our software applications. That also included:

• On-boarding clients for VOD and Post Production workflows.
• Automating software using Ruby and Shell scripting.
• Inventing and implementing new BPM workflows.
• Defining and requesting resources for new applications.
• Coordinating software upgrades.
• Assisting in pre-sales to demonstrate new technologies.
• Deploying and maintaining (high performance) Linux systems.
• Performing R&D tasks for complex customer cases.
• Maintaining relationships with vendors of Encoding systems.

Tools and techniques used:
• IBM Aspera Orchestrator
• Ruby (+ Rails) with RubyMine
• MS SQL
• AWS Elemental
• FFmpeg
• SAM Alchemist XF
• Rhozet Carbon
• Manzanita Multiplexer
• Interra Baton
• JIRA
• Cloud Services
profile_positions.title: Workflow Specialist

profile_positions.description:
During my time as a Video Encoding Specialist I was mostly working on the technical on-boarding of new Video On Demand clients and platforms. That included:

• Consulting and communicating with clients to streamline the on-boarding process.
• Automating and deploying custom workflow processes in various (BPM) workflow systems.
• Developing tools and scripts in the languages Ruby, AutoIt and Batch.
• Collaborating in writing responses for RFP’s.
• Setting up transcoding profiles and defining XML Metadata standards.
• Writing technical specifications for content delivery.
• Maintaining and configuring high performance Linux machines.
• Collaborating with our software developers to specify and test new functionality.
• Assisting colleagues with technical questions.

Tools and techniques used:
• IBM Aspera Orchestrator
• Ruby (+ Rails) with RubyMine
• LOOMS
• AWS Elemental
• FFmpeg
• SAM Alchemist XF
• Rhozet Carbon
• Manzanita Multiplexer
• Interra Baton
profile_positions.title: Video Encoding Engineer

profile_positions.description:
As a Media Manager it was my responsibility to deliver Video on Demand assets to platforms on time. That included:

• Communicating with studios and clients to request materials in the right video and audio format.
• Outsourcing operational tasks to Media Operators (syncing, QC).
• Performing video, audio and subtitle grouping and repairs on delivered assets.
• Cutting delivered materials into a clean master.
• Ingesting materials in the MAM system.
• Making adjustments to the configuration of outlets in the MAM system.
• Ordering media assets to deliver in the right format on the right time.
• Monitoring the media ordering workflow in the associated systems and transcoders.
• Reporting of ingested and delivered materials.

Tools and techniques used:
• LOOMS
• Final Cut Pro
• Rhozet Carbon
• Tektronix Cerify
• FAB Subtitler
profile_positions.title: Media Manager

profile_positions.description:
• Developed an application in AutoIt that automates audio encoding, BPM measuring, graphical waveform generation and communication with the back-end of the webpage.
• Developed a video player using ActionScript that gives users the ability to place comments in the timeline.
• Researched and deployed the necessary tools to perform Blu-ray Mastering.
• Authored and mastered several Q-Dance Blu-ray projects, such as Qlimax and Defqon.
• Assisted in audio multi track recording for big music events.
• Video editing of a few Dutch TV commercials.

Tools and techniques used:
• Sonic Scenarist (BD)
• AutoIt with Scite
• ActionScript 2/3
• Adobe Flash Professional
• SAWStudio
• Sony Vegas
profile_positions.title: Software Developer / Studio Employee

profile_positions.description:
During my graduation internship at iMMovator I took part in project ‘10-10-10’ as a part of the Dutch Media Hub.

• Researched the current situation of video material exchange between broadcast organizations.
• Conducted interviews with technical managers of the larger broadcast- and other facility organizations in the Netherlands.
• Made an analysis on the used video formats, audio formats, transfer methods and connectivity.
• Took place on the NAB show in Las Vegas as part of the Dutch Media Hub.
• Done research on file transferring solutions on the NAB show.
• Benchmarked file transferring solutions by simulating larger RTT using Linux.
• Wrote and published my thesis on video file exchange which has been communicated as a part of the ’10-10-10’ project.

Tools and techniques used:
• Microsoft Word and Microsoft Project
• Ubuntu Linux
• PHP
• MySQL
• FileCatalyst
• UFTP
profile_positions.title: Graduation internship HBO Mediatechnologie
